intro: Fumana hispidula var. pabularis, commonly known as the hairy fumana, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its growth habit is usually low and spreading, with a mat-forming structure that helps it colonize disturbed soils.
